newsitem.title: GERMANY: Chemical leaks into Rhine river from BASF plant.
newsitem.headline: Chemical leaks into Rhine river from BASF plant.

text.p: Around two tonnes of an irritant chemical leaked into the Rhine river early on Saturday morning after a flaw developed in a feed pipe at BASF AG's plant in Ludwigshafen, the company said.

The leak, involving a liquid form of the poisonous gas formaldehyde, was noticed immediately, the pump through which it escaped was switched off, and the pipe system was emptied, the German chemical group said in a statement.

BASF said it had informed the authorities of the accident and initial observations had not revealed damage to Rhine waters. Formaldehyde posed a threat to water but was easily broken down biologically, it said.
"Because of the sheer volume of water involved in this case, no negative impact is to be expected," BASF spokesman Martin Buellesbach said.
Formaldehyde is a pungent colourless substance commonly used in the manufacture of glues and plastics.
